simplenlg.realiser
Class CoordinateVerbGroupSpec

java.lang.Object
  simplenlg.realiser.Spec
      simplenlg.realiser.PhraseSpec
          simplenlg.realiser.SyntaxPhraseSpec
              simplenlg.realiser.VerbGroupSpec
                  simplenlg.realiser.CoordinateVerbGroupSpec

public class CoordinateVerbGroupSpec
extends VerbGroupSpec

This is the class for Coordinated verb phrases. A coordinate VP is represented as:

  • A set of features (which determine the nature of the auxiliary group)
  • A conjunction ("and") by default
  • A list of main verbs

All the children of a CoordinateVerbGroupSpec inherit its simplenlg.features, that is:

  • tense
  • perfect
  • progressive
  • passive
  • negated
  • form (a value of Form)
  • mood (a value of Mood)

The default realisation of a CoordinateVerbGroupSpec is as follows: AUX + main verb conjunction. Thus, there is one auxiliary.

The default aggregation behaviour can be overridden using setAggregate(boolean).

Examples involving aggregation:

  • The instrument was being tried and tested (progressive, past, passive)
  • It rained, snowed and hailed (past)
  • John has been arrested and detained (present, perfect, passive)
  • The dog has been being fed and watered (perfect, present, passive, progressive)

Author:
agatt
See Also:
VerbGroupSpec.coordinate(VerbGroupSpec), SPhraseSpec#addVerb(String)

addCoordinate

public void addCoordinate(VerbGroupSpec vg)
Adds the head verb of a VerbGroupSpec as a child of this coordinate verb group. Note that the argument can itself be a CoordinateVerbGroupSpec, in which case, all its children become children of this one. All children of a CoordinateVerbGroupSpec inherit its features.

Parameters:
vg - The verb group to be added.
See Also:
VerbGroupSpec.coordinate(VerbGroupSpec)

addCoordinate

public void addCoordinate(Verb v)
Add a Verb. This method is exactly like addCoordinate(VerbGroupSpec) except that it takes a verb as argument.

Parameters:
v - The Verb
See Also:
addCoordinate(VerbGroupSpec), VerbGroupSpec.coordinate(VerbGroupSpec)

getCoordinates

public List<Verb> getCoordinates()
Returns:
The list of coordinates, children of this phrase.

setAggregate

public void setAggregate(boolean aggr)
The aggregation parameter determines whether the CoordinateVerbGroupSpec is realised with a single auxiliary phrase with wide scope over all the coordinates or not. By default, this is set to true. This accounts for "aggregated" coordinate VPs such as john was eating and drinking. If set to false using this method, the example becomes john was eating and was drinking.

Parameters:
aggr -
